frameDefinitions: The words in this frame describe situations in which a Perpetrator forcibly seizes control over a Victim's Vehicle to gain some end.  '' 'French farmers have hijacked a lorry and destroyed its load of strawberries.'
A Destroyer (a conscious entity) or Cause (an event, or an entity involved in such an event) affects the Patient negatively so that the Patient no longer exists.
In this frame a Deformer deforms a Patient possibly against a Resistant_surface such that it undergoes a shape-change from its canonical or original shape into the Configuration, a new shape.
An Agent affects a Patient in such a way that the Patient (or some Subregion of the Patient) ends up in a non-canonical state.
An Agent or Cause is responsible for placing a Valued_entity at risk.
A  Counter_actor or Cause  impedes an Agent in an Activity or impedes the unfolding or continuation of a State_of_affairs.
frameExamples: French farmers have <t>hijacked</t> a lorry and destroyed its load of strawberries.
Ellen <t>crumpled</t> the paper into a ball.
His actions have <t>imperiled</t> his immortal soul!

However, as this story goes on the Queen of Sodom has a brother who
plans to <t>undermine</t> his sister and take the throne of Sodom.
listRoleDefinitions: This is the person (or other agent) who forcibly seizes control over a vehicle to gain some end.
This is the means of transportation which gets under the control of the perpetrator. Example: The terrorists hijacked <fex name='Vehicle'>the plane</fex>.
This role describes the people that are suffering as a result of the <fen>Perpetrator</fen>'s action.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs the intentional action that results in the <fen>Patient</fen>'s destruction.
The entity which is destroyed by the <fen>Destroyer</fen>.
The event or entity which is responsible for the destruction of the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Destroyer</fen> destroys the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Destroyer</fen> destroys the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The <fen>Deformer</fen> is the one who does the reshaping.
The <fen>Patient</fen> is the entity acted on and that undergoes a change.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is an animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces an effect. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of <fen>Cause</fen>s.
A state that holds of the <fen>Patient</fen> or a relation that holds among the constituent parts of the <fen>Patient</fen> as a result of the arranging action.
The role <fen>Time</fen> identifies when the <fen>Deformer</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> indicates where the <fen>Deformer</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs the intentional action that results in the damage to the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The entity which is affected by the <fen>Agent</fen> so that it is damaged.
An event which leads to the damage of the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> damages the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the location of the scene where a <fen>Agent</fen> damages a <fen>Patient</fen>.
An (non-sentient) entity or state of affairs that leads to the peril to the Valued_entity.
The entity which may be negatively impacted as a result of the emperilment.
The sentient entity which causes the risk to the <fen>Valued_entity</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Valued_entity</fen> is put in danger.
The location where the <fen>Valued_entity</fen> is put in danger.
An event or state_of_Affairs that successfully impedes an <fen>Agent</fen> or a State_of_affairs.
A person who intentionally or not acts in such a way that an <fen>Agent</fen> or State_of_affairs is impeded.
A person who is intentionally engaged in some <fen>Activity</fen> and who is impeded in that <fen>Activity</fen>.
An <fen>Activity</fen> that is being impeded.
A state or event that is ongoing and whose continuance or unfolding is impeded.
The time at which the <fen>Counter_actor</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> works agains the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Counter_actor</fen> subverts an <fen>Activity</fen>.
listRoleExamples: The rebels skyjacked a plane <fex>with 89 passangers</fex>.
<fex>The subsequent explosions</fex> leveled most downtown office buildings.
<fex>The lieutenant</fex> crushed it angrily with his boot before looking back at Hencke.
Jack plucked the flower out of his morning coat and closed his fist slowly over it , crushing <fex>it</fex> into a pulp.
<fex>The strong winds</fex> deformed the structure of the outhouse.
The lieutenant crushed it angrily with his boot <fex>before looking back at Hencke</fex>.
<fex>The crash</fex> dented my car pretty bad.
Tory rebels queued to warn that <fex>they</fex> wouldsabotage efforts to put the treaty through Parliament .
If he is really undermining <fex>me</fex>, then he is a fine friend.
The Dominican Republic was widely held to have undermined <fex>its own efforts to become a full member of CARICOM</fex>
Whenever I try to quit they all try to sabotage <fex>my efforts</fex>.

passageCandidateSpans.text: Confederation of Netherlands Industry and Employers

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Confederation of Netherlands Industry and Employers
